TopicTitle: No Fuel from tanks reaching motors?

Articles.Content:
I built a rover last nite using KSPX mod along with stock parts. I used the stock lattice work girders to frame out the wheel assembly and used the cupola module as the base. I put a fuel tank on gridwork and four motors at each corner for landing.

All the parts I used say they are 'cross fed fuel' capable but yet the motors do not show any fuel reaching them.

Any ideas?

I cant post a pic of the rover atm since Im at work, will do later today though.
what motors are you trying to fuel? the stock rover wheels need electrical charge (anywhere on the ship) not liquid fuel.
Sorry, the motors are for landing on Mun. I will post a pic of the rover tonight so you can see what I built.

K, here is my rover.

http://i.imgur.com/nf4GNG3.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/HcfAuGJ.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/xsDzRfz.jpg

I put the two fuel lines in there on a off chance that they would force the fuel out but it didnt work out so well.
Im pretty sure those girder segments are not fuel crossfeed capable. Not sure how to fix, can you run the fuel lines directly to the engines?
Being fuel crossfeed capable is weird. I don't know if its bugged, or if it just works weirdly. Sometimes it works properly, and sometimes it doesn't.

You have to connect both the Fuel and Oxy tank to the girder directly. Those tanks are mounted radially. They need to be connected to something. Fuel doesn't flow unless there is a fuel line or a direct node connection. You could probably just connect the tanks to the capsule as long as there isn't a no flow or decoupler part between the capsule and the girder.
You can also run fuel lines directly to the engines pieces themselves.
You need to use fuel lines for those tanks, otherwise it will not work.
